title: The Money for Nothing Edition
description:
On this week’s episode of Slate Money, host Felix Salmon chats with co-hosts Cathy O'Neil of mathbabe.org and Jordan Weissmann of Slate about scarcity-based valuations of music, the wonders of short-selling, and the fortune cookie theory of patent law. 
 This week's sponsor: This week’s sponsor: Citrix GoToMeeting! Visit GoToMeeting.com and click the “TRY IT FREE” button.
Join Slate Plus! Members get bonus segments, exclusive member-only podcasts, and more. Sign up today at Slate.com/moneyplus
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
itunes:author: Slate Podcasts
itunes:subtitle: Slate Money on whether Wu Tang Clan's album can sell like fine art, a stock plunge for Lumber Liquidators, and reasons we have patent trolls.
